title: Alternative to Papyrus typeface
content:
I'm currently working on a project in the natural health industry. My client is really in love with the font Papyrus. I'm hesitant to use this typeface because I feel like it has been overused in this industry. Can anyone think of any alternatives that share a similiar essence of this font?

Thanks,  
Baskervillebold
author: baskervillebold

comments.content:
Send them here, unless they don't understand irony, in which case pray that they never see this site:

[I Heart Papyrus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165234/http:/www.iheartpapyrus.com/)

Check out some of Scriptorium's faces (many are available as working demoware):

[http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/renaissance/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165234/http:/www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/renaissance/ "http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/renaissance/")

[http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/colonial/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165234/http:/www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/colonial/index.html "http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/colonial/index.html")

Veer also has some wonderful distressed semi-scripts:

[http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?producttype=typ&clarify=false&ke...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312165234/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?producttype=typ&clarify=false&keyword=grunge+or+distressed+or+rough "http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?producttype=typ&clarify=false&keyword=grunge+or+distressed+or+rough")
I was was able to persuade them away from it... Thanks for the the link to I Heart Papyrus. It helped my case.
